meanings.definition: The quality of being able to be chosen or selected.
meanings.sent1: Her electiveness as team captain was evident in how well she led the group.
meanings.sent2: The electiveness of the new voting system ensured fair representation for all.
meanings.sent3: The electiveness of the magic wand surprised everyone at the talent show.
meanings.sent4: His electiveness in picking the right ingredients made him a master chef.
meanings.sent5: The electiveness of the flashlight in the dark forest saved the day.

meanings.definition: The effectiveness or success of being chosen or selected.
meanings.sent1: The electiveness of the marketing campaign led to a significant increase in sales.
meanings.sent2: His electiveness in decision-making made him a valuable asset to the team.
meanings.sent3: The electiveness of the umbrella in the rain made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: The electiveness of her smile brightened up the entire room.
meanings.sent5: The electiveness of the medicine in treating the illness was remarkable.
